result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph L. Salituro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph L. Salituro is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph L. Salituro was found guilty of Deliver Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: On or Near a School], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay fine of $1000  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes:
Huber privileges are allowed
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Joseph L. Salituro, appeared with Attorney Frederick L. Zievers.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 4 months in the KCJ commencing on 11/5/16 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.  Court imposes a fine of $1000 plus costs & surcharges to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. Defendant, Joseph L. Salituro, appeared with Attorney Frederick L. Zievers.  Clerk: PT
Atty Zievers requests an adjournment of sentencing as there are some facts that ADA Binger is aware of that ADA Braun was not aware of.  Upon hearing statements court grants adjournment.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing moved to 9/2/16 at 10:30 AM due to calendar conflict with a 2 hr motion and new date confirmed with Atty Zievers.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Joseph L. Salituro, appeared with Attorney Frederick L. Zievers.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2 & 3 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.

NO RECORD TAKEN:    Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant, Joseph L. Salituro, appeared with Attorney Frederick L. Zievers.   Clerk: PT
Parties state case is resolved but due to a lengthy motion in another case the plea hearing is set over to next week on 6/28/16 at 11:10 AM.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Joseph L. Salituro, appeared with Attorney Frederick L. Zievers.  Clerk: PT
Atty Zievers requests an adjournment as he is waiting for one additional piece of discovery re: conversation between DE and drug officer and Atty Zievers has been in communication with ADA Graveley.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 09:50 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Joseph L. Salituro, appeared with Attorney Frederick L. Zievers.  Clerk:PT
Atty Zievers expects case to resolve and parties mutually agree to an adjournment.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:40 am.
for Substitution of Counsel (Atty Frederick Zievers for Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath)

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Frederick Zievers.  Clerk K. ZIrbel.  Parties are exploring alternative dispositions.  At the request of both parties, FPT adj. to 5/12/16 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  At the request of Atty Hertz-McGrath, FPT adj. to 2/17/16 at 9:20.  Bond continued.
Atty Hertz-McGrath is out sick today.  FPT rescheduled for 1/6/16 at 10:30.

Parties are still negotiating and Atty Hertz-McGrath requests another adjournment; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 10:50 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Joseph L. Salituro, appeared with Attorney Denise s Hertz-Mcgrath.  Clerk: PT
Atty Hertz-McGrath requests an adjournment for further resolution; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
